1.long_description: Whether or not the images you wish to analyze are 3D.

Yes.cellprofiler_suggester: You said your images are 3D. Please make sure to select this in the NamesAndTypes module

No.cellprofiler_suggester: You said your images are 2D. Please make sure to select this in the NamesAndTypes module

Yes, but I wish to Z project them before.cellprofiler_suggester: You said your images are 3D but need projection. Please first run a pipeline to project them (a written and video demo are available [here](https://forum.image.sc/t/input-modules-tutorial/63911#h-3d-processing-4814-6)). Once these are created, the now-2D projections can be used in their own CellProfiler pipeline.

15.long_description: The median diameter of the object you want to segment, in pixels

cellprofiler_suggester.3D_False: In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 1-5
In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 2-8
In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 8-40
In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 25-120
In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 80-350
In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 250-1200
In IdentifyPrimaryObjects, a good initial guess of 'Typical Object Diameter' is 800-3500

19.full_name: Measurements requring other objects and/or image context (select all that apply)
19.long_description: Measurements that don't come from just the object being measured, but from its relationship to some other object. This might be an object of the same kind (such as a cell's distance to its closest cell) OR a different kind of object (such as the number of speckles inside a nucleus)

cellprofiler_suggester.3D_False: To measure the count of parent/child objects of a different type, once both kinds of objects (the larger 'parent' objects and the smaller 'child' objects have been found), use the RelateObjects module to connect them. If you want to calculate per-parent means (ie if you want to know in each nucleus, what is the average speckle area), make sure to put RelateObjects AFTER your measurement modules
cellprofiler_suggester.3D_True: To measure the count of parent/child objects of a different type, once both kinds of objects (the larger 'parent' objects and the smaller 'child' objects have been found), use the RelateObjects module to connect them. If you want to calculate per-parent means (ie if you want to know in each nucleus, what is the average speckle area), make sure to put RelateObjects AFTER your measurement modules

cellprofiler_suggester.3D_False: You said you wanted to measure distance to and/or overlap with other objects of the same type. CellProfiler only supports direct object overlap under certain circumstances, such as the UntangleWorms module, and doesn't currently have a good way of measuring it. If you want to calculate distance, you can use the MeasureObjectNeighbors module
cellprofiler_suggester.3D_True: You said you wanted to measure distance to and/or overlap with other objects of the same type. CellProfiler currently doesn't support object overlap in 3D. If you want to calculate distance, you can use the MeasureObjectNeighbors module

cellprofiler_suggester.3D_False: You said you wanted to measure distance to and/or overlap with another kind of object. This can be measured with the MeasureObjectNeighbors module and/or the MeasureObjectOverlap module
cellprofiler_suggester.3D_True: You said you wanted to measure distance to and/or overlap with another kind of object. Unfortunately, CellProfiler currently doesn't calculate object overlap in 3D. If you want to calculate distance, you can use the MeasureObjectNeighbors module
